standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply and extend previous understandings of addition and subtraction to add and subtract rational numbers; represent addition and subtraction on a horizontal or vertical number line diagram.

hints.content: Go to $-2$, then move $7$ more to the left.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 2 units to the left and is labeled as negative 2. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 7 units further to the left and is labeled as negative 7. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-2+(-7)$ takes us to $-9$ on the number line.
Go to $-4$, then move $2$ more to the left.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 4 units to the left and is labeled as negative 4. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 2 units further to the left and is labeled as negative 2. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-4+(-2)$ takes us to $-6$ on the number line.
Go to $-2$, then move $5$ more to the left.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 2 units to the left and is labeled as negative 2. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 5 units further to the left and is labeled as negative 5. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-2+(-5)$ takes us to $-7$ on the number line.
Go to $-1$, then move $5$ more to the left.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 1 unit to the left and is labeled as negative 1. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 5 units further to the left and is labeled as negative 5. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-1+(-5)$ takes us to $-6$ on the number line.
Go to $-7$, then move $1$ more to the left.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 7 units to the left and is labeled as negative 7. Another arrow from this tick points 1 unit to the left and is labeled as negative 1. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-7+(-1)$ takes us to $-8$ on the number line.
Go to $-2$, then move $9$ more to the left.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 2 units to the left and is labeled as negative 2. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 9 units further to the left and is labeled as negative 9. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-2+(-9)$ takes us to $-11$ on the number line.
Go to $-6$, then move $7$ more to the left.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 6 units to the left and is labeled as negative 6. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 7 units further to the left and is labeled as negative 7. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-6+(-7)$ takes us to $-13$ on the number line.
Go to $-3$, then move $3$ more to the left.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]
